entities: Group of Experts on the Democratic Republic of the Congo
summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions, particularly 1756 (2007),

Notes the final report (S/2007/423) of the Group of Experts on the Democratic Republic of the Congo,

Condemns the continuing illicit flow of weapons into the Democratic Republic of the Congo,

 Declares determination to monitor implementation of the arms embargo and enforce measures against those acting in violation,

Expresses concern regarding armed groups and militias in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo,

Notes the report of the Security Council mission to Kinshasa (S/2007/421),

 Finds the situation in the Democratic Republic of the Congo a threat to international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,

1. Extends until 10 August 2007 the arms embargo imposed by resolution 1493 (2003) as amended;
2. Extends, for the same period, measures on transport imposed by resolution 1596;
3. Extends, for the same period, financial and travel measures imposed by resolutions 1596, 1649 (2005), and 1698;
4. Extends, for the same period, the mandate of the Group of Experts referred to in resolution 1698;
5. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
